skill.name: string-database
skill.description: Query STRING API for protein-protein interactions (59M proteins, 20B interactions). Network analysis, GO/KEGG enrichment, interaction discovery, 5000+ species, for systems biology.
skill.summary: Query STRING API for protein-protein interactions (59M proteins, 20B interactions). Network analysis...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. External command detections are markdown code fences, network access is to legitimate STRING database API, filesystem operations save visualization images, and heuristic alerts are standard API client patterns. No malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Access protein-protein interaction networks from STRING database covering 59M proteins and 20B interactions. Perform functional enrichment analysis, discover interaction partners, and generate network visualizations for systems biology research.
actual_capabilities: Query protein-protein interaction networks from 5000+ species
Perform GO and KEGG functional enrichment analysis
Identify interaction partners and hub proteins
Map gene names to STRING identifiers
limitations: Requires network access to string-db.org API
Limited to publicly available STRING database data
Rate limits apply for frequent API calls
Visualization returns image data for saving

use_cases.title: Protein interaction analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze protein networks for gene lists from proteomics or RNA-seq experiments

use_cases.title: Pathway enrichment
use_cases.description: Identify enriched GO terms and KEGG pathways in protein sets

use_cases.title: Interaction partner discovery
use_cases.description: Find and visualize proteins interacting with a protein of interest

prompt_templates.title: Basic network query
prompt_templates.prompt: Use string-database to get the interaction network for TP53 and MDM2 at high confidence (score 700)

prompt_templates.title: Functional enrichment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform GO and KEGG enrichment analysis on these proteins: TP53, BRCA1, ATM, CHEK2, MDM2

prompt_templates.title: Network visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a confidence-colored network image for these cancer genes and save as png

prompt_templates.title: PPI enrichment
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if these proteins form a significantly connected module: BRCA1, BRCA2, PALB2, RAD51, ATM

output: Top TP53 interactors: MDM2 (score 999), MDM4 (score 995), ATM (score 957)
MDM2 is the strongest interactor with experimental evidence
Generated network image showing TP53, ATM, CHEK2, BRCA1 connections
Edges colored by evidence type, thickness by confidence score

best_practices: Map gene names to STRING IDs first for faster queries
Use confidence score threshold appropriate for your analysis goals
Wait 1 second between API calls to respect rate limits
anti_patterns: Do not use low confidence thresholds for publication figures
Do not omit species parameter for large protein lists
Do not skip error checking when parsing API responses

faq.question: What confidence score should I use?
faq.answer: Use 400 for exploratory analysis, 700 for high-confidence interactions for publications.

faq.question: Which species are supported?
faq.answer: Over 5000 species including human (9606), mouse (10090), yeast (4932), and E. coli.

faq.question: How many proteins can I query?
faq.answer: The API handles lists efficiently, but for thousands of proteins use the web interface.

faq.question: What output formats are available?
faq.answer: TSV, JSON, XML, PSI-MI for data; PNG and SVG for network images.

faq.question: Is an API key required?
faq.answer: No key needed for basic queries. Registration required for bulk analysis features.

faq.question: How to cite STRING in publications?
faq.answer: Cite the latest Szklarczyk et al. publication from string-db.org/about
